qas.question: What were some of the downsides of the more liberal Soviet Union?
In which country did Warsaw Pact regime remain in place?
What party did Gorbachev belong to?
What was the name of the legislative body that was brought into existance in 1989?
When were opposition parties first allowed in the Soviet Union?

context: This liberalization, however, fostered <a0_0>nationalist movements and ethnic disputes<a0_0/> within the Soviet Union. It also led indirectly to the revolutions of 1989, in which Soviet-imposed communist regimes of the Warsaw Pact were peacefully toppled (<a1_0>Romania<a1_0/> excepted), which in turn increased pressure on Gorbachev to introduce greater democracy and autonomy for the Soviet Union's constituent republics. Under Gorbachev's leadership, the <a2_0>Communist Party<a2_0/> of the Soviet Union in 1989 introduced limited competitive elections to a new central legislature, the <a3_0>Congress of People's Deputies<a3_0/> (although the ban on other political parties was not lifted until <a4_0>1990<a4_0/>).
